name: Amazing view of fjord & mountains glamping Birdbox

reviews.comments:
Amazing camping experience Great location only 19 minutes driving from the nearest town.

Definitely a car is a must! Try to check the weather before booking cause I wasn’t able to use the grill nor sit outside which would have completed the wonderful experience.

3 hours from the airport, you will be using a ferry back and forth but the charges will be paid by the rental office and deducted out of your deposit.

This is A Unique 1!

This was an incredible experience! Worth every penny! The bed was big and comfy, it was warm inside the box and cozy.
A few things to know: it is on a working farm with lots of sheep so you will need good footwear because there is poop all over the path. There’s about a 200 meter trek to the box and the last bit is pretty steep so try not to bring too much stuff with you when you go.
They do have a fire pit and supply wood as well as a sterno for coffee.
There is also a flushable toilet which is nice!
This is glamping at its finest!

Wow! Stunning views, just like the pictures (or maybe even better!). Comfortable bed and a very cozy hide-away. The bathroom in the nearby barn only has the basics (a toilet, no running or warm water). A few cooking supplies can also be found in the barn, but don't expect to be able to cook a full meal (bring some quick and easy food with you). The walk from the parking is short, but steep. Bit pricey, but definitely worth it for a special stay!
Love our stay at the birdbox! It was cosy and comfortable.
Amazing view in a great place!!!
Amazing views and relaxation at Birdbox. Would recommend to any couple looking to get away for a one of a kind “glamping” experience in Norway.
back to nature with such a majestic location! Recommend to go!
The views and tranquility here are truly amazing! We roasted marshmallows by the fire and watched the sunset. Would absolutely recommend, such a unique place!
Just as pictured, a perfect place to escape into the beautiful nature Norway has to offer!
Great place to stay. Stunning view.

We loved our stay at the bird box! The view was extraordinary, and we loved the experience overall. We wouldn’t hesitate to recommend the bird box experience and are so happy we did it.

One area for improvement could be cleanliness- we found a bunch of hairs on the pillows and sheets, there were a number of Beatles and other bugs in the bird box including under the mattress, and there was trash in the farmhouse garbage can from the previous guests. I’d recommend more thorough cleaning between guests, as well as providing an electric fly swatter.

Some tips/extra info we wondered about before visiting: We followed our normal map app to the location, which worked perfectly. We carried only a small backpack up with us, which made the 5 minute mostly uphill walk easy.

For dinner, we used the camping stove and water kettle to boil water, which we added to instant soup cups and ate with forks and spoons we brought (all purchased at a grocery store in Norway). There was also firewood and a fire pit. There was no fridge, though the night was cool enough that we felt comfortable keeping yogurt in the farmhouse overnight.

The toilet was totally clean and was a proper flush toilet. We brought our own drinking water, though a small amount was provided. There was a standard European outlet in the bird box. The heater and vent fan both worked totally good in the cool September night to keep us comfortable. There was also a provided flashlight and there were also overhead lights in the bird box.

There were no curtains, so either bring an eye shade or just enjoy the view in the morning!
We had an amazing stay, the view is absolutely stunning!
Pictures do not do justice to the experience of the birdbox - it was the best Airbnb experience we've ever had. Loved it! You must make the trip out here (be sure to rent a car).

Amazing view 😍
Easy to reach with a car
The view from Birdbox is amazing and cannot be captured in photos. The bed was comfortable and there are more than enough supplies for some basic cooking on the fire.

We had an excellent stay at the bird box.
The views are picture perfect and seem unreal!
The bed is very comfortable and there was also plenty room for our belongings.
We took a medium size suitcase and a back pack.
If you are taking a suitcase like me, make sure it is sturdy as the path is very steep and uneven, also a section of grass to travel across, but we managed fine with ours.
We travelled by public transport and this was a smooth and simple journey from Bergen, via Forde.
Torstein was very helpful with this and also very quick with replies.
Could not recommend this place enough.
The stay was amazing and a unique experience.

Absolutely stunning views and a once in a lifetime experience. I’d definitely recommend hiking shoes to get up and down from the bird box. It was raining for us so the ground can be quite slippery. Would stay again!
Amazing view, amazing place where to spend the night
Great view. At least as beautiful as in the pictures

primaryHost.about:
Born and raised in a small town on the west coast of Norway between the mouintains and fjords. Im working as a ship designer at Brødrene Aa as well as designing tiny cabins and workspaces with attention to detail and connection to nature in Livit, founded by me and 2 partners. Also im a father currently enjoying the baby life!

Follow me at  @TorsteinAaDesign (insta)

reviews.comments: Beautiful home in peaceful surroundings! We had a great time here cozying up inside while watching the snow fall outside. I especially enjoyed that the place was very well insulated and especially enjoyed the heated floors. I would definitely return!
Wow the view is amazing, we booked two nights but still not enough, will get back soon
We had a great time skiing, hiking, and visiting QC. The view from the chalet simply amazing!

Beautiful place. We had to drive around a bit after the gps direction ended because we missed a turn but overall our experience was great. Nicholas was unable to secure a private chef (which I wanted to surprise my wife with) because it was last minute and they were all booked  but he offered to even pick up and deliver dinner for us himself. He also let us check in early since we got there sooner than we thought and the cleaner had already finished.
As you turn the corner and see the house, you will be in awe. Nothing can prepare you for the awe, beauty, and peace of this place!
Great experience. I’d highly recommend if you’re looking to get away from the city. The view is phenomenal.

This place is remarkable. You cannot miss the experience to stay in this adorable chalet.
Yes, I am coming back.
Thank you Nicolas.
The view is fantastic, highly recommended for romantic getaway! You will have an unforgettable experience.
Awesome place!!!  Loved every second of our stay!!
Was a beautiful stay! Loved everything about it. Feel like your out in the woods but only 15 min into town and 25min into the city.

What a beautiful home and location! We enjoyed our stay very much. We hiked the local trails, had easy access to state parks, Old Quebec. The local restaurants were very good, especially Archibalds and the boulangerie! We appreciated the recommendations Nicolas made. Check in/out very easy. We had everything we needed during our stay and we’re very comfortable. You would be hard pressed to find a more stunning view anywhere! It’s a peaceful escape.
The chalet has a great view, I’d recommend it to anyone looking for an escape from the city.

My wife and I loved this magical little glass hut that lives at the top of a mountain. The uninterrupted views make you feel like you’re a part of the landscape. It’s sensational.

The proximity to Lac Beauport for grocery shopping and to Quebec City for some history makes this ideal for both total escape and interesting culture. We loved it.

Thank you, Nicolas, for making this a lovely trip for us.
The experience was absolutely amazing, the chalet was very well stocked with kitchenware items. It was super cleaned and the instructions were very clear, we plan to come back in the winter next!

We had a wonderful stay at this Airbnb. The location is great as it’s only 20-25 mins drive to Quebec City and there are 2 IGA grocery stores 10 mins drive away. The chalet is perched on a mountain that has multiple hiking trails so there is no need to go elsewhere for a nice hike. The place is very clean. It is compact but has all you need for the comfort of 2-3 people: hot shower, full kitchen, AC, heated floor and fireplace (one outside and one inside). It even provided children utensils and plates which became handy for my toddler. The only thing to note is that the stairs are outdoor. If you want to access the second floor from inside, you need to take a ladder. (This is well-written on the chalet’s description.) For those with limited mobility, this is something to consider.

The view is just spectacular. We came on a particularly rainy week but it allowed us see all the various weather changes and how it reflects onto the scenery. On the sunny day, we went for a hike on the mountain. On the rainy days, we visited Quebec City and its museums.

The host was very responsive. I reached out for technical questions and also information about the mountain. He responded within an hour and more often than not, within 20 mins.

It was definitely a great getaway for my husband, my toddler and I. We are looking to come back in the summer.
Thank you for hosting a great place
Simply incredible jaw dropping views! Would definitely go back

Beautiful and well designed tiny home with spectacular views. Close to quebec city yet at the same time you're completely immersed in nature. Nicolas is a great host, responds promptly to messages and very accommodating.
Would highly recommend a stay there!

Like everyone else’s review, the view was amazing and the architecture of the chalet is cute and minimalistic. The water from both kitchen and washroom are filtered. This chalet is so nice and cozy. You can just stay there and enjoy the view all day.
Breath taking !

photos.caption: La vue époustouflante de la chambre principale.
Foyer Jotul 370 au gaz comme source de chaleur principal au Rez-de-chaussé. Grillages anti-brulures pour les enfants.
Cette planche de merisier se trouve dans le garde manger. Déposée sur les tabourets, elle permet de créer une table.

Machine Nespresso Inissia (capsules originales). 4 capsules fournies.

Nous avons aussi une machine à Café filtre, dans le rangement sous l'évier de cuisine. (filtres inclus)
Il y a deux facons de voyager entre les étages. L'échelle verticale permet de rester à l'intérieur de l'unité.
Si vous avez à transporter des objets d'un étage à l'autre, il est recommandé d'utiliser l'escalier extérieur!
Il y a 3 toiles solaires dans la chambre des maîtres.
Si vous désirez utiliser le poêle extérieur, prévoyez apporter votre bois et matériel d'allumage.

reviews.comments: Our stay was perfect!  We enjoyed the peaceful surroundings and beautiful cabin! Everything exceeded our expectations! We will definitely return in the future! We absolutely recommend!
Love all the windows and the hot tub! We had such a nice little anniversary getaway.
Best possible way to connect with nature and to feel free! The sounds of nature and the waterfront made it so relaxing! Can't wait to return!
Everything we dreamed of. Second stay was even better than the first. Will be back soon.
Absolutely loved our stay! The place is beautiful and the hot tub is the icing on the cake. Will definitely return and Alina is the sweetest!

My honey and I wanted to get away and relax for a few days before the holiday craziness began and this exceeded every expectation!!! The hot tub was very clean and inviting! The chandelier was everything!!!
Sitting outside, I felt like I was in Colorado or something. Definitely takes you out of what you think Lumberton, TX can offer you!
The views, the privacy, the animals, just WOW! We cannot wait to return. Thank for you for a wonderful experience!
This was exactly the escape we needed. Such a relaxing and beautiful place to unplug. We look forward to coming back!
This was our second trip here and it didn't disappoint. If you're looking to relax and unwind this is the place. I'm already thinking about the next time we can come back.

It's a beautiful stay. The grounds are lush and green. Our cabin was in between swamp and river, giving us privacy and immersion into nature. In the morning, the cows mooing was wonderful and humorous to wake up to. Hot tub was clean and warm. Mosquito spray and cooking amenities were provided, as well as a complimentary breakfast. The bed was comfortable and the hanging feature was fun! It doesn't move a bothersome amount. Alina was helpful and easy to reach out to. We had fun using the Victrola! We came during a warm December, but it was never sweaty indoors. The water in the shower was hot with good pressure. The two decks would be an excellent spot to fish, but we just went and bought catfish - we prepared it with the provided amenities and ate by the fire pit. Overall, a highly pleasant experience, and I'll be sharing the information with all my friends. Thanks!
Beautiful and very romantic! Everything is set away from other people. Perfect place to spend time and focus on your group and enjoy nature!
This place was absolutely perfect! Exactly has described and couldn’t not have chosen a better spot for our anniversary weekend.
Amazing place, extremely  beautiful, and very peaceful!! Extremely nice people would recommend for anyone wanting to recharge  and love nature!
So beautiful and romantic ❤️😊 perfect for our anniversary

Beautiful cabin located by the creek on the owners property. It’s surrounded by enough by trees to make you feel secluded. Especially for the outdoor shower. Hot tub was spacious and clean. Bed was very comfortable and stable, was a little worried about it being suspended with rope, but they had it pretty secured so it didn’t swing around like crazy. Plenty of soft towels provided with bathrobes.

No indoor kitchen, but electric griddle pans were provided to cook outside. They had eggs, bacon, and orange juice in the mini fridge which was a very nice treat. Keurig coffee maker and coffee was also included.

You’re also about 15 mins away from grocery stores and restaurants so you can go into town if needed and also Village Creek State Park if you want to do some hiking.

Overall it’s a great quick couple’s getaway and would recommend for a glamming experience.

I so enjoyed my stay at the Naturalist Boudoir. My husband and I celebrated our 19th wedding anniversary getaway here. Using the outdoor shower when it is 38 degrees was difficult dang TX weather lol. LOVED the privacy of being surrounded by water. The hot tub and swinging bed where icing on the cake. Would highly recommend this location. Can’t wait for my next visit when it is warmer ;-).
Great secluded place for two to enjoy.
This cabin was amazing. Very relaxing environment and so beautifully decorated. The outdoor space exceeded my expectations.
we loved it !  we hope to return
Beautiful, tranquil, romantic stay.

My husband and I had a really, really great time here.
Everything was so perfect!
The bed and bedding was perfect!
The hot tub was perfect!
All the beautiful windows and view was perfect!
All the amenities was perfect!
The design and decor was so perfect!
Our amazing host was perfect!
Even the smell of the towels was perfect!
This place was just an absolute dream! And we will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Your home away from home awaits.
Outdoor shower with hot water on demand.
Sitting area to watch the water ebb by.
Decks for relaxing, dancing, fishing or grilling.
View of waterway.  Look close, you may see a gator or two.
Romantic at night with gorgeous outdoor lighting.

primaryHost.about: Nature loving, outdoorsy, happy, outgoing, fun-loving lady.  Love to travel and meet new people.  Feel so blessed to live where I do, just want to share with others.  Hope to meet you soon.

reviews.comments: A unique experience staying in a guitar shaped house! The apartment is comfortable and well equipped with all you need for a short stay. Host was friendly and helpful too! Just mind that if you are traveling with heavy luggage, you’ll need to carry them up 2 flights of stairs to the apartment.

One of the best spots of ever stayed! The house was tiny and cute! The community outside was very Unique! We stayed one Sunday night and they had people playing guitar downstairs we decide to go down and drink with them and sing with them. Felt like her own private concert. Would definitely go back
We really enjoyed our stay and checkin was very easy!

When I got off Seoichuan IC, it was nearby, so it was nice to move by car!! One regret was that the bathroom drain didn't drain well, so it was a pity.

localizedReview.comments: I liked the view of the two thousand porcelain village from the private terrace. I woke up sleeping on a soft blanket in a clean accommodation, and it was so fresh. I was able to heal properly enough to be completely satisfied with my friend who brought me ~!!

localizedReview.comments: It was neat and I liked the bedding so much. Cozy feeling, warm lighting! There were a lot of stocked items, and the area was quiet, so it was a perfect place to stay for a healing trip.

localizedReview.comments: The location was so good and the hosts were so nice. There are convenience stores and Hanaro Mart nearby, so it was a great environment to cook and eat. I came out on the terrace and roasted meat, but the atmosphere was so nice!

primaryHost.about: A software engineer who lives in South Korea.

name: Alianz Loft
address: San Roque de Barva, Heredia, Costa Rica

reviews.comments: Eric is very helpful with our needs and was responsive

A home built of glass is expected to be a little less private, but the noise level was excessive. The neighborhood didn't match the house in that there were loud children all around yet a glass house for occupants to be on display.
The noise was really bad, with the children, airplanes flying overhead, and construction that started before 630am.
The house is not sealed as the glass panels and doors have large gaps that allow bugs and noise in, and let's the AC out. Overall, it's a home that may work for families with children as long as being on display is not an issue. And there is no dishwasher even though listed as an amenity. I do not know how difficult it is to remove/edit amenities are with AirBnB, but the response to my inquiry about this was flippant.
Exactly like the pictures. BUT this is not a quiet retreat.
very cool Airbnb, we had an incredible stay!

Very futuristic home! So cool and unique, like no place I’ve ever seen before!
The host was sure to leave lots of thorough directions around the home so you didn’t have any questions which was very thoughtful.
The futuristic vibe is what attracted us to the home but another good feature is its proximity to the airport, it was perfect being so close to SJO as opposed to driving 3-4 hours from somewhere on the day of our flight. We stayed here on our last night in Costa Rica and it made our commute to the airport a breeze!
We had the best time! It was a perfect honeymoon spot!

This is like the Black Mirror meets Men In Black meets the house from movie Belly. Very futuristic. This house is a vibe as the kids would say. Could be a little cleaner in some places. Great stay and location from San Juan. very lively town. The ceiling in the garage opens up to be the floor in the living room. Jacuzzi was great during rain showers. secure location. very stimulating. great place to experience. one of a kind. literally.
This was a really futuristic place super cool
Fantastic futuristic themed stay! Definitely recommend staying here!
Super fun place to stay
Amazing place to spend a night.
Amazing, best Airbnb I have ever been to hands down
Everything was wonderful.  It was exactly what was portrayed.  Much nicer than what we expected even.  Eric’s communication was wonderful the whole time.
Beautiful place! Once in a lifetime stay
Don’t even think twice about booking this spot. This house is so dope! Architect went crazy!!! I’m coming back
The place is amazing!
The place is amazing

(READ ALL) Okay first thing is first. This place is beautiful and stunning. The bunnies are cute and friendly and same for the neighbors. There is a nice view peaking out from the upstairs bed room of the Mountains and city (left hand side).
The one annoying thing is, if your just like me and hate construction noise and want to escape it then you will get a tad bit annoyed. I’m from New York City and hate construction noises. So, when I go on vacation, the place I stay at needs to be peaceful, especially from construction noises. At 5:30AM construction starts expect on sundays right in front of this Loft. And its loud it will make it hard to even conversant or even watch a show. Also, right before we had to check out our water was turned off due to the construction. We were talking showers getting ready to leave <- anyone could understand how annoying this is
Especially when you have to check out at a specific time. Its such a bummer because this place would be a 10/10. But because of all of was I explained, It was about 6.5/10 or 7/10.
Beautiful space that is unique.
It was a good experience, highly recommend.

name: Sunflower House
address: El Port de la Selva, Catalonia, Spain

reviews.comments: One of a kind! The house is beautiful and well thought, the architect work is great. Amazing vista, location on a quiet district of El Port de La Selva. Extremely kind people welcome you and are ready to help whenever you need it. Thank you!
Beautiful home with a stunning view.  My family and I loved our visit to El Port De la Selva.  Thank you for hosting!

Geoff is the owner of one of the most beautiful places I've seen in the world. It is in a hidden gem of a city north of Barcelona and I was able to rent a car for under $100 and get there and back in a 2hr drive each way (mostly
highway). I proposed to my fiance here and we hope to be back to celebrate anniversaries for years to come. The management company was extremely efficient and professional .
good stay, easy check in, do recommed Geoff!!!!

The house is very special. Beautifully located. From an architectural point of view, very interesting.
But from our experience there are a few things that have to be mentioned.
First of all there is no air condition in the house only little electric fans. It was hot at night and uncomfortable.
The toilet and shower have transparent door in front of them, so you are visible.
I must say that the next remarks were written before by several guests before us and were not taken care of.
For instance the house was not vacumed. Couldnt use the master bedroom because the sheets were stained. The corian tub was yelliw inside. No other shower in the master bedroom. We moved to another room, there were hairs all over the floor.
Curtains dirty and hanging loose.
Soap dedpeser in the kitchen broken.
Toilets with shit splash. And the toilet seat with stains that I myself cleaned.
Sofas are old and ruggy.
The owner knows about it now, he dsid he will take care of part of the remarks we sent him
BUT NO AIR CONDITION

Astonishing house in an impressive location. The views to the sea are unbelievable. Walking distance to beautiful coves and beaches. Great attention and very responsive host.
We will repeat next year for sure. It might have become our yearly family tradition!

This home and the surrounding area is fantastic. We loved the house, the rugged coastline, and the friendly and unassuming ambiance of the people and general area. We would love to come back for another stay.

We very much enjoyed our stay at the sunflower house and the view is amazing - the sunrise, the dolphins we spotted from the house, the pool and the hiking trails right by the house all added great value to our stay.
The house is beautifully designed and has striking views and an architectural layout. That said, it needs some love, care and paint to look like the pictures; eg. curtains are not hanging right, door handles are missing, it could use a deep clean, and general maintenance.
From the pictures it did not give us the impression that a road runs right in front of the house ( in July there is a lot of car and foot traffic to and from the beach by the end of the road) nor does the pictures show that multiple houses (probably not built when pictures were taken) are very close neighbors.
Also, there is no A/C - only fans - which makes it practically impossible to cool the house down by just opening the windows (temperatures in the house were above 30 c degrees at all time during our stay).
Perfect placement, perfect house, unforgettable views. I totally recommend
Stunning! Easy to get to the beach and walkable to town. Closer to neighbors than I expected but it didn’t detract from the experience. A must visit!
We enjoyed every bit of it. We couldn't have had a better vacation. We will definitely be booking it again next year!

Great location, amazing views, nice little port town. Geoff is really helpful and really nice. The Sunflower house is the perfect place to relax and enjoy everything the region has to offer. What you see in the pictures is what you get, a wonderful place!!!
A special place with an amazing view. I'll definitely go back!
The house is just amazing! The view, confort, space…. I recommend 100%
Very nice place we enjoyed the stay, Worth a visit again 👍🏻👍🏻
This house is amazing. The architecture is amazing and a view that feels like heaven. The area quiet and we loved to stay there. Would aleays reccoment to friends

Amazing house even better from the pictures.
Waking up to Beautiful sunrises from the bed
The pool is not heated so we could not use it.

We loved our time at Geoff’s house.  That VIEW!!! The views are incredible, the location is close enough to the village, but quiet and relaxing.  The house has all you need to cook and enjoy the amazing outdoors.  The pool is great and the beach is at the end of the street.  An incredible time was had by our entire family.

I fully recommand this place.
Geoff is available and always answers to all questions.
The place is amazing ❤️

I found this Airbnb through a random search of interesting looking homes. I am so glad I found it because this has got to be the most breathtakingly gorgeous homes I’ve ever stayed in. The town of El Port de la Selva is quaint and full of lovely people (many do not speak any English, so a basic knowledge of Spanish might be necessary).

primaryHost.about: I'm British but I work in The Hague with my Australian wife and two children. I've studied, lived and worked in various countries but now call El Port de la Selva home where we come whenever we can.

reviews.comments: Unique and beautiful property. Fully stocked kitchen. Easy directions and good communication.

Absolutely wonderful! Unique architecture and spacious, super clean and views of the ocean and Sunrise to die for. Will be back for sure.

Annie & Ismael

It difficult to locate, address should be 16, not 165. Parking very tight. Lots of stairs inside, not all have railings. Only one bedroom has en suite pool is heated, smaller than expected, but perfect. What is needed to get around. This place is lovely, but has clearly been designed more for aesthetics than function. With that in mind, it was amazing. View could not be improved on.
Casa increíblemente bonita con unas vistas espectaculares. Arquitectónicamente una joya. Piscina climatizada y todo lo necesario para unos días inolvidables.

localizedReview.comments: Amazingly beautiful house with a spectacular view. Architecturally a jewel. Heated pool and everything you need for a few unforgettable days.

reviews.comments: Superbe emplacement pour cette non moins superbe maison. La propriété est propre et très bien équipée. Nous y avons passé une très bonne semaine à 2 familles de 3 personnes. Attention au nombre de marches dans la maison qui exclue les personnes à mobilité réduite et les trop jeunes enfants. Ne pas non plus venir avec une trop grosse voiture car l'accès et le stationnement ne le permettent pas

localizedReview.comments: Great location for this no less great house. The property is clean and very well equipped. We spent a very good week there with 2 families of 3 people. Pay attention to the number of steps in the house that exclude people with reduced mobility and too young children. Do not come with a too big car either as access and parking do not allow it

reviews.comments: Spannendes Haus mit faszinierenden Design

localizedReview.comments: Exciting home with fascinating design

name: Paradise Ranch Inn Stellar House Hot-Tub,Sauna .

reviews.comments: Was one of the coolest airbnbs I’ve stayed at. Awesome drive and view, would highly recommend even if you’re just passing through.

Absolutely loved staying at this AirBnB! The location is so serene and with the hot tub, fire pit, and sauna, it's really a perfect getaway destination. The river was a beautiful view to wake up to. The outdoor kitchen was also really easy to use. Kenneth is also such a responsive host. He gave us very clear instructions, great recommendations in town, and made us feel welcome.

The AirBnB is about 30-45 minutes away from Sequoia National Park. It's an easy drive and convenient if you're planning to visit while you're staying in Three Rivers. I really can't wait to stay again.

Kenneth put together a beautiful oasis. The location is so intimate and you’re truly able to appreciate what’s around you and the people in front of you. I felt so connected to myself and I my fiancé like never before. If you were looking to escape and you’ve come across this beautiful Airbnb. DO IT! You need it more than you know!

Kenneth was so helpful while we were there, and very responsive to whatever we needed! He’s a peaceful and friendly energy to have around and it was nice to know we had help whenever we needed it!

We definitely plan on coming back !

Thank you for the stay, Kenneth!

By far the best place I've ever stayed. We stayed for 3 nights so we could visit Sequoia, but then chose not to leave until check out because the place was so magical. I'm still stunned at how perfect everything was. You can tell that every aspect of 'paradise ranch' was artfully crafted with a specific vision. So many details that only someone with passion for the project would include.
The glass house was immaculate. Everything you could need, all new/high quality items.
Spectacular view and privacy. Great for watching wildlife since they can't see through the mirrored glass.
Hot tub and sauna were obviously wonderful as well.
Overall, everything in the listing is accurate but it can't capture how top-tier this experience is
Unreal locale with a great host! We are already planning our next stay!

I’ve stayed at many AirBnBs all over the world throughout the last 8 years. Kenneth’s Paradise Ranch is, without a doubt, the best experience I’ve ever had. It is as advertised and more. I stayed in the Stellar house which is very thoughtfully designed and elegantly placed in this stunning valley. Would have been easy to stay inside and watch the world go by through the glass walls all day. But there is a lot to do on the property. The hot tub is right outside the door. The sauna is a short 30 sec walk away by the river, which is frigid in November but worth the swim :)

Kenneth was very responsive and accommodated our requests leading up to the stay. The listing and glowing reviews are all accurate. It’s really something to experience.

Kenneth’s place in the deep mountains close to Three Rivers is a place hard to reach but easy to fall in love with. The living unit is small but well-designed and has everything you’ll need to live through a calm retreat. The glass/mirror construction gave us a full view of the beautiful riverbank yet granted us privacy and calm. The highlights of this trip are the nature surrounding the ranch and the hospitality from Kenneth. Today’s Airbnb experience often becomes transactional and robotic, making an energetic and kind host willing to speak and explain stories behind himself and the place very rare and inspiring. Paradise ranch is for someone who’s seeking a calm, simple, and off-the-grid journey. If you are that person, IMHO, you won’t be disappointed.

Our stay was an experience we will not forget! The home is beautiful and Kenneth makes you feel right at home. The views at night are unmatched, the sound of the waterfall is calming and soothing. Thank you for having us in your home!

What a magical place! Absolutely breathtaking property! We had a glorious stay. It was exactly what we need to unplug and reconnect with nature and each other. The Stellar House is a modern design marvel. A cozy, comfortable- well thought out pod which infuses you into the surrounding environment. Only wish we could have had a few more days. Just do it you’ll not be disappointed!
reviews.response: Thank you awww so happy great meeting you both ;)

reviews.comments: Had an incredible time. The perfect mix of nature and amenities. The Stellar house was gorgeous inside and out. Everything was functional and beautiful. Especially appreciated the water kettle and the pour over coffee maker. The location was amazing; I really can't wait to come back.
reviews.response: So happy your journey made it by my ranch, makes all the hard work worth it ;)

reviews.comments: We loved our stay at the Paradise Ranch.  Everything was as described and simply perfect!
reviews.response: Thank you ;) like Rumi  said love is love ;)

reviews.comments: Definitely will come back here again! A unique place where you have definitely never been! Unbelievable experience!
Amazing!!! U have to go

This place was even better than the pictures/description listed.  A fantastic little house on the edge of a river with a magnificent view (day and night), everything worked amazing (I'm going to have to buy that bidet for my wife now) and it was a great getaway.  Sequoia/King's Canyon park is super close so sightseeing and hiking is great, or just stay around the house, lounge in the hot tub and take in the quiet and the beautiful views.  We shared some photos on social media and have been fielding questions from friends about where we stayed and how they can do the same since we got back.  Truly a fantastic experience I would unquestionably repeat again.  If you have ANY hesitation about making a reservation, put it out of your mind, it's worth it and an experience you'll remember for a long time to come.

My wife and I stayed here for a 2 night getaway. It was fantastic. We highly recommend it to anyone who is looking for some rest and relaxation. The unit is minimalist yet luxurious--extremely comfortable. We ended up spending most of our time in the unit because it was so comfy and the view of nature was so awesome. We loved waking up to the sunrise in nature. There is a sky light that opens up if you want a breeze and there is air conditioning if the unit gets warm in the afternoon. We'll definitely be back.

I wish I could give 6 out 5 stars!
The place is incredible, everything well thought. It's modern, cozy, brand new, very clean, beautiful location, awesome views, the river at our disposition and the host is SUPER NICE.
I wish could had stayed forever :)
Don't think twice, you have to visit this place.

Wow! My wife and I stayed here in October and it was just perfect! The river was cold and refreshing, and the hot tub and sauna were so warm and relaxing. The house was very modern, clean, and minimal; just what you need. Definitely worth the trip and we look forward to coming back soon!
This place is very beautiful and relaxing. Only an hour drive from sequoia national park. Plus you can enjoy trails and the river right next to the houses.

Paradise Ranch was awesome! We thoroughly enjoyed our time here and Kenneth the host was very accommodating with great communication. This place is truly a hidden gem!!

I will say however the drive into Sequoia National Park was a bit longer than we would have liked and the abundance of flying insects was a annoying at times (especially when cooking). But the park itself had a lot of flying insects too so this is not just Paradise Ranch. Bring some all natural bug repellent and you’ll be fine.

Overall we enjoyed the hell outta our stay a would love to come back again! Thanks again Paradise Ranch!!

Wow! What a special place in the backyard of the Central Valley. First off, Kenneth is an amazing host and was just a phone call away if help was needed. It was nice to connect with nature, swim in the river, relax in the cedar wood spa, and cuddle up next to the gas fire pit under the night stars all while enjoying high end modern amenities within the container. The shower is a must!

Some warnings:
The last 10 miles is mildly unpaved with potholes. I would not bring any lowered sports car here. The signs are limited to the ranch and cellular data drops off, so make sure to write or print out the directions given. There isn’t any easy access for food except for about 30 min down the hill so make sure to pack up food for your trip. There is a lovely hibachi grill and gas burner available.

Will definitely come back! Thanks Kenneth for creating this magical place.

photos.caption: Wake up here and let the skylight guide when you wanna start your day .
Japanesse Lux in the end it’s all clean .
Some say it’s the best shower they have ever tried . Especially if you love to be under pressure;)
Hottub yes it’s cleaned with Ozone and UV light . And infused with cedar .
Bathhouse with Sauna for the Bell tents.
This is the place where lots of great scripts, books and new vision will be communicated from .
When The sauna was under construction.
let's move some wood to build some wood.
Yoga time or lifting your spirits waking up to this makes you realize quickly that "paradise is within you"
Our solar powered, every day we get a bit closer to our goal of being totally off grid as this ECO idea evolves .
Soooon the sauna will open ;) promise.
A kitchenette with just what you need.
Help me make a 100 sculptures in the garden .
Bring a bag of ice and fill your cooler with all the extra goodies that makes your weekend perfect .
Suggestions take a outdoor shower rinse of in cold water and get infused with the lovely cedar hottub . ;)
Xlocks makes it so perfect to enter this enchanting space some of my guests never leave the box ;)

primaryHost.about:
Hi, I’m Kenneth Willardt , a Dane, world adventurist by heart and photographer  of anything  beautiful to be ;) . Lived full time in NYC until the lockdown . Sold it all, closed
my base/ studio and build a dream in the backyard of the Sequoias on a 50 acre ranch with a crystal clear 1 1/4 mile river running through . 
Yes, I’m here to serve and this place has been very healing for me so I would like to share the energy and properties of this ancient virgin land . I traveled to Estonia and found these 5 OOD house mirror/selfie houses as some say and brought the company across the pond, all for you to love and connect with the Estonian concept and the Danish minimal luxuries design hand crafted by Americans , I took all the good things that I felt was missing on my travels and compacted it into the essence of what you need to feel nurtured and loved . Nature will heal you here trust me, ohh and yes drink lots of the water here it has very special and healing properties. ;)

name: Aura House 2bds Eco Bamboo House, Pool, River View

reviews.comments:
Aura House is Otherworldly. Every facet of my stay here was the pinnacle of perfection.
The house itself struck the ideal balance of nature and luxury. In an open-air villa in the middle of the jungle, there was no problem with bugs. This was my biggest concern, and its absence still baffles me. Despite heavy rains, our treehouse remained completely dry. The air conditioned bedrooms had blissfully comfortable & cozy beds. The bathrooms were spacious & stunning. The lighting design was impressively optimized for the space, its thoughtful flexibility adding to the exquisite experience.
The service was peerless exceptionalism. Their thoughtful, proactive attentiveness gave me the comfort & confidence of a solid safety net, despite being over 10,000 miles from home. Upon arrival, the staff knew us by name and where we were staying. Oka & his team orchestrated a seamless spectacular experience tailored to our individual preferences & tastes.
A week later, I am still in awe.
Very nice jungle stay in bamboo house and responsible host.

The architecture of the bamboo villas is stunning, unique and beautiful.
The service was kind and responsive.

Although the place was a little underwhelming in that there wasn’t much todo.
The nature is beautiful but that’s true for most places in Bali, so I didn’t think the price paid was necessarily worth the two nights we spent there. Compared to other stays in bali.
The food also wasn’t what you would expect from a place like this. Again especially since the food in bali is amazing. We were underwhelmed.
Certainly worth a visit for the beauty of the architecture but I don’t think worth the money for an over night stay.
Such a beautiful and environmentally sustainable place to stay!!

Went on our honeymoon, loved the place so cozy and big! three floors filled with magic. Although it's completely exposed to the jungle we did not have many insects interrupting our stay or cooking sessions. Loved the food, staff and community! deff a  must when coming to Bali!
Amazing place, very friendly staff and services on site. We had a great few days here. Very relaxing
Great experience

What a place to stay! It’s one of the best decisions we took to book the villa. It’s completely a different world experience altogether. Staying close to nature in the middle of the rainforest with great amenities and amazing views. The service is also very good though you’ll be able to order in the villa by 5pm, not later than that. Be prepared for a few insects though which gather around in the evening - we did get scared because they were all over the place as soon as it became dark. However, within two hours, it all became normal. Breakfast is served from the menu of fixed options to choose from. The food is quite good. Though not a lavish 5 star spread but good enough to satisfy the breakfast hunger. Kitchen is decent, so you can cook for yourself as well. The experience of living in a bamboo house that too near the river getting to hear the sound of water flow and in between the greenery was a great experience.

We had a great stay. awesome views, great staff and calm atmosphere. Children loved the house cat. The food from warung was nice too. pizza party on sunday was awesome!

We would have liked not to have the house cat taking the freedom to come into the rooms 😊

This is a great spot to visit, super responsive host and always checked in to make sure we were enjoying our stay. However, it is quite far away from Ubud so if you are planning to explore the city be prepared for about a 40 min drive if you can even get a ride. Otherwise absolutely stunning location and would recommend to anyone who wanted to stay on the property!

This place had been on my bucket list since I discovered it and it didn’t disappoint. If you can get a booking, take it! Waking up here was an absolute dream. Staff all lovely and kind. If you can, try and do the village tour as well and check out some of the other incredible houses here
Highly recommend to book this place - the view from the balcony is so stunning and the help and support we got from Endra and the team is tremendous!

ONCE IN A LIFETIME opportunity to stay here! The most beautiful accommodation we’ve ever stayed in and the team running Green Village - everyone from arrival, chef, cleaning - were truly amazing and made this trip so special. They were beyond accommodating, often helping us navigate difficult travel situations during the rainy season, even opening the kitchen late when we got stuck in a storm and missed a dinner reservation. Amazing food (we ate here most nights it was so good and authentic), massages in our rooms, and unbelievable scenery. I cannot recommend this accommodation enough!
The most beautiful place I’ve ever been in my life!

The house is amazing. It is one of our most memorable airbnb stay so far. The bed is comfortable and the kitchen has everything you may need. The host Wayan is very responsive and help us with whatever we need. The location is 20-30min away from ubud so not bad, just not much to do here after check-in. I just wish they offer motorcycles rental so we can explore surrounding areas. Overall, we are so happy we are able to stay here. Thank you so much for a wonderful stay!
Beautiful stay! Loved the ambiance and the views!
Amazing experience, truly unique stay in a jungle right next to the river

Aura house was amazing. The property was very clean and comfortable. Staff is super friendly and there’s even some cute cats and dogs roaming around the property. The on-site restaurant prepared delicious food and the house was unbelievable.

Aura house is a very unique house in the middle of the jungle.  It was a great experience, a very clean and cute bamboo house. No matter what I will write here unless you experience you never know how unique was this stay.
Amazingly beautiful setting and house. Staff are friendly and great communication.

photos.caption: View from Aura House living room

name: Newest Simple Survival Earthship Studio
address: Taos County, New Mexico, United States

reviews.comments: Great cozy location with great views and purpose!

Beautiful cozy little space with plenty of blankets to keep you warm. Amazing how it stayed 68 degrees (F) with no heat! The concept is incredibly inspiring.

Slightly expensive for what it was with cleaning supplies tucked in the corners and greenhouse needing a bit of TLC but sweet finishing touches to made it very welcoming.

Thank you for hosting us.

Lovely cozy space. Very quiet and peaceful getaway from noise in the city at home. Our first time in an earthship was great- the space felt safe and comfortable; the architecture was unique and we really value the idea of sustainable living as well as affordable housing for all. I hope more people come to learn that sustainable living is not only possible but beautiful. Thank you for the opportunity & we will be back to explore more earthships.
Beautiful and interesting stay. Really gives you food for thought on how and why the rest of society lives the way they do. Would highly recommend to anyone who’s curious about off-grid living!

Very unique experience at #10 Earth Ship and learned so much about sustainable living by taking the guided tour and staying in the earth ship. We strongly recommend for the people who like to explore the sustainable living.

After learning about Earthships, we wanted to try staying in one, and the experience did not disappoint! The Earthship is beautiful, and my partner and I loved coming home to the fresh plant smell of the greenhouse! The Earthship remained at 70 degrees even when it was 90 degrees outside in the summer heat. The shower is wonderful, and the bed is very comfortable. Wifi worked great. We enjoyed going for a long walk and seeing other Earthships from the road. Only a few minutes drive from the Rio Grande Gorge Bridge, so a beautiful drive every time! I highly recommend staying here!
Incredible stay with an incredible view.  The earthship really opens the mind to possibilities and inspires creativity.  Absolutely worth it and would love to stay again.

The SSS Earthship was a wonderful experience for my wife and I. Personally I have been interested in this style of living for nearly a decade and to finally experience it first hand has sold both she and I on it completely. Michael was communicative, directions were very easy to follow, check-in process was a breeze, and the site itself was beautiful. Where else can you be in the high-desert one moment and standing next to banana tree in bloom the next? Strong recommend.
What a great experience to stay in an earthship home! Very well done, the bathroom and shower were excellent. Best night of sleep I have gotten in a while!

This place lifted me up when I was in a rough spot! Little oasis and perfect for some solitude.

There is pretty good wifi also 😊
This is a real Earthship incorporating all the principles. If you want to try one out, this place will give you the experience you are looking for. It is nice and clean, and check in is hassle free.
This property was such an amazing and unique stay! Very clean and great location with all Taos has to offer.
Great place for comfortable off grid living in an awesome Earthship!!!  It is a must see.  We are already booked for a second stay!
This earth ship was AMAZING! My boyfriend and I watched a documentary on YouTube about earth ships so we wanted to check one out. It blew us away…. I would stay over and over again!
Excellent location if you’re either in the area or want to get a feel for how living in a Earthship might be. Highly recommend!!

Incredible experience staying in this stunning Earthship. Such a cozy home. We had everything we needed. The shower is a dream. We especially loved watching the sunsets and hearing the coyotes howling at night. Don't hesitate to stay in Michaels Earthship!

perfect for 2 people. my only suggestion to future guests is to check out the roads beforehand during the winter season and make sure that you have a all wheel drive. my daughter and I got stuck in the snow while trying to find the place initially. it will make for a good story and we can now laugh about it. Michael was very helpful and accommodating.  I would recommend this experience! it's really interesting how these earthships are self sustainable.
Highly recommend a stay. Undervalued in my opinion

This was our first stay in an Earthship, and in a nutshell it was a fascinating and truly unique experience. During the first day of our stay mother nature had greeted us with a winter storm, including considerable snowfall, and very cold temperatures. We appreciated that some snow had been removed prior to our arrival or we likely would have gotten stuck trying to park. Both nights the temperature reached the sub-zeroes, yet we were amazed that the temperature in the living and sleeping room never fell below the upper 60s, and was quite comfortable. It was fascinating learning about the self-sufficiency aspects of this Earthship and of those in the community in general. It was a great overall experience and we would return.
This place is gorgeous and such an amazing concept. I encourage everyone to experience the magic that the Earthships bring. Will definitely be coming back!
this was the coolest place i’ve ever stayed at! love it!

My wife and I chose this special place for the new year evening to stay.  It was a really good and unforgettable experience!  The stuffs here are very responsible, friendly and helpful. Since we just got married last Christmas day, we got a lot of wedding photos here by ourselves. The towers makes our photos amazing. Highly recommend this special place for staying at Joshua tree!  Wish we could come here again in the summer!
Had such a wonderful time! Host/Owners are super friendly and respectful. We made use of the room service and the food was so delicious and beautifully presented.
reviews.response: Awe thank you! We love that you used all the amenities we offer at The Castle House - Estate. We hope to see you soon!

reviews.comments:
This place is amazing! 10/10 will stay again. It’s so great for a few nights in Joshua Tree because it’s an extremely unique experience.

The best part for us was the fire pit service. I’ve never had “room service” deliver whatever I wanted to us at a fire pit - including more wood for when we ran out but still wanted to continue the night. We had a couple hand made old fashions and then moved into the Hall for a movie.

They had laid out cushions, blankets and pillows on which to get comfy cozy before we ate popcorn and watched a big screen projector. Every one of these services costs extra like sauna, movie night and even morning coffee (there was a nesspresso machine in tower 2 but no pods). The extra costs can add up but it was totally worth having the options!

We are absolutely looking forward to staying here again next time we come to Joshua Tree!
reviews.response: We are so happy you used all the amenities. We have curated a space to provide a lot of options. We love the movie theater experience. We just updated our concessions options so next time you will have a lot more options. Our apologies regarding the coffee pods. We addressed that with our team since that is supposed to come standard with each stay. Thank you for the feedback and we look forward to seeing you guys in the future.

reviews.comments: Gorgeous property! Stunning place for sky watch too. Quiet and peaceful
A unique stay in Joshua Tree! The sunset views on the roof are spectacular!
Amazing place for retreat. Stunning view from the roof and even from the window (you don’t need to leave but to check sunrise). Host is friendly and responsible

A great place to stay.  The location was peaceful and private.  Loved the camp fire site and being able to see the stars.  The host was responsive and answered our questions quickly.  This was definitely a trip to remember!  I definitely recommend
Everything was perfect! I highly recommend you give this place a look if you want a unique desert stay :)
Bathroom is in a trailer away from unit.

This place is amazing. we stayed in tower 2 . amazing sunset and sunrise view. host was wonderful, they bring firewood and s'mores the moment we ordered, we made friends with fellow travellers from other tower.

Everything was so perfect! I celebrated my birthday here and it was so calm and everything I was looking forward too! I enjoyed star gazing and having a fire near by the tower. I as well enjoyed showering outside since it was something I’ve never done before😜! Amazing place, can’t wait to come back!
Easy instructions and friendly. Loved my stay

We had an absolute great time!!! Thank you to the hosts you guys were awesome. The guard tower was so fun and just what we needed for a getaway out of the city. Such a cool experience, couldn’t have asked for anything better. Will definitely be back!

My daughter and I stayed here for a night after a long week of traveling.  We could not pass up the chance to stay in the guard tower.  The property is absolutely stunning and so very unique.  The hosts were wonderful and we loved the on-site room service.  Much needed after traveling all week.  The mountain views and the sunrises and sunsets are the best.  Will definitely be back!
I enjoyed the amenities very much so!
Our stay at The Castle House Estate was absolutely perfect! The castle was exactly as described and such an amazing experience! We will definitely be back!

One of the most amazing nights I have ever experienced. Castle 2 had an incredible view of an amazing sunset and the rise of the rare harvest moon. The entire property was truly breathtaking and unlike anything I have ever seen for a camp type site. The boho style here couldn’t have been more spot on for my hippie self. The owners are very attentive, helpful, and take amazing care of this property. It is located just minutes from Joshua Tree National Park. I can not wait to go back and stay for much longer than one night. If it was an option, I would move there immediately haha. Out of all the things I saw during my stay, The Castle House Estate’s and Joshua Tree National Park made my entire trip everything I wanted, needed, and more. Thank you!!!
I enjoyed seeing the stars at night

My sister in-law and I decided on taking a last minute weekend trip to Joshua Tree. We were lucky enough to find the Castle House estate and were able to book one of the towers 2 days prior to our arrival.
Our entire stay from checking in to checking out was so easy and enjoyable. The owners were so helpful and attentive to all of our request and questions and were a quick phone call/text message away.
Highlights of our stay had to be our time hanging out under the palms at the pool deck. Sunset strolls through the property’s beautiful landscape. And star gazing from the tower roof top.
We were not very prepared and did not bring any refreshments or food, but thank god they had room service that we fully took advantage of.
Don’t forget to bring your roller skates. The disco roller room has a jukebox and amazing lighting

10/10 Highly recommend. Would stay here again.

photos.caption: Abu our camel available for events

primaryHost.about:
The Castle House Estate consists of 4 unique stays and a total of 13 units across 12 acres. The grounds have been meticulously manicured and the property has a resort vibe. The Castle House Estate is available for full property buyouts and has a 3500 square foot meeting space that can be used as a dining hall, nightclub and a roller rink.  There is an additional 2000 square feet of white cantilevered concrete patio on all four sides of the structure.  The sunset patio has a 250 person capacity for private dinners with views of the National Park.  

We have several listings on airbnb from individual units and the entire compound.  We hope to see you soon. Our team is here to assist you throughout the booking process - during your stay - and wishing you well on your trip home.

reviews.comments: My wife and I had never even heard of an “Earthship” before, now we only want to stay in Earthships! This place was absolutely amazing and completely unique. Michelle was a great host and the setting could not have been more beautiful. If you’re visiting in the winter, as we did, you should be prepared for a remote wilderness experience, even though it’s technically close to downtown Boulder. If there is significant snowfall you won’t make it up the steep road to the house without AWD and/or chains. We ended up leaving our rental car at a pullout off the main road and hiking up to the house when the snow was heavy.
An absolutely unique and fantastic home. If you’re looking for a quiet mountain getaway, this is the place for you! It’s even better than the photos. And Michelle was a great host.
reviews.response:
Ashton, it was a pleasure to host you! Thank you for your excellent communication during your stay and letting us know about the door after your stay. It never ceases to amaze me that guests often don't bother to mention things that need attention etc. Things we might not notice straight away without a heads up. Thanks again!

Kindly, Michelle

reviews.comments: Incredible place. Uniquely wonderful experience. Fantastic hosts.

Earthy, wholesome and simply perfect. The space is extremely clean, full of light and beautiful history. Michelle was super friendly and helpful. Private jacuzzi on top of the mountain was the cherry on top! We will definitely be back.

This place was truly otherworldly! Make sure you have an AWD or 4WD car regardless of the weather I’d say as the road is bumpy. Very cute and secluded with a well stocked kitchen, nice hot tub, and eco friendly. I would definitely bring robes and slip on shoes if you go in the winter as the hot tub is up a hill and can get hold to walk from in the winter months. Otherwise we loved it! Would 100% stay again.

This sight is magical! The views, the stars, the amazing indoor eco system, the list goes on. The espresso machine was such a luxury that seemed like a dream. Beds were comfortable. Behind the beds and on tops of dressing chests were quite dirty and the main house smelled of cat urine…even with those factors, I’d be willing to rent again. 😆
Me and my gf loved the place. Would love to visit again one day!
So amazing. So so amazing. Not sure there’s much else to say!
Excellent location and place, beautiful views and fantastic hosts. Would definitely recommend it for individuals looking to plug out.
Incredible property!  Wonderful communication, couldn't recommend more highly.

The host mentions several times that the final 1-2 miles is an uphill dirt road, and recommends a 4WD vehicle. The road is quite steep, but very flat – you don’t need something with super high clearance. When the weather is good, and the road is dry, I believe any car would make it (the neighbors were driving up in a little Smart Car). Once snow falls, I would not feel comfortable in anything less than AWD or 4WD. Again, the dirt road is well maintained, it’s not washed out, but it’s very steep.

Also as a word of caution to others driving up, the dirt road should be taken mindfully as it is only 1 car wide for the majority of it, and you need to be aware if other cars are coming the opposite direction (infrequent, but we did end up having to do a shuffle past someone at one point).

The seclusion is incredible, absolutely astounding. If you want to avoid seeing another person, this place is the ticket!

The house itself is absolutely gorgeous. The pictures are accurate. Incredible views and location.
We stayed in this little gem and loved it. The house is beautiful and the views are amazing!

This is a quiet, funky, relaxing place. My friend and I had a lovely time recharging. The location isn't too far from Boulder, but feels remote. We even saw a mountain lion -- it walked down the lane while we were sitting on the patio! Overall, a fantastic experience.
Absolutely amazing!!
Magical place. Fig tree growing inside the kitchen. Split-leaf philodendron in the shower. Relaxing, cozy, sun-filled. Already thinking about coming back.

Absolutely epic space in every way. Just book it!

The road up is absolutely manageable (at least in September). It feels like you’re in a different universe. The host is kind, communicative and helpful. Hikes within 15 minutes that are stunning.

We’ll be back.

This place is stunning. So peaceful, stunning and a great place to unplug and enjoy the beautiful scenery. Very private and a relatively convenient drive from both Boulder and Denver. The hosts were kind and highly communicative. Would absolutely recommend.

I’m afraid if I say how wonderful the place was that it will book up and I won’t be able to stay there again.

Really special.
We absolutely loved this place! Such a beautiful view in a unique spot. The drive up was a bit scary the first time, but you definitely get used to it. What a memorable vacation!

Unlike most Airbnbs, this one was actually NICER than the photos :-) Our group of 4 adults (two couples) enjoyed our stay immensely. Wonderful, quick, help & communication from the hosts (thank you Michelle!), made the trip a breeze.

The well-appointed kitchen with some pantry staples (oils, salt, pepper, white sugar and more) made it possible to really cook real meals at the house.

The earthship itself was beautiful AND comfortable, inside and out. As the listing notes, the second queen bedroom is up the hill from the main house by the hot tub, and at the time we stayed, doesn't have running water or a bathroom (you return to the main house for that). It wasn't an issue for our group, but, if you're worried, something to check out with the hosts as it looks as if they are working on some renovations in that space that may help.

As for the road, it is mainly steep and narrow, but we navigated it in our SUV with no issue in low gear.

And, last mention. Bring a warm jacket so you can stay outside on a clear night so you can see the stars (and the Milky Way at certain times of year!) rising over Sugar Loaf Mtn. Beautiful. We loved our peaceful stay at the house, and would certainly visit again. Thanks!

photos.caption: Welcome the Sun: South-Facing Glass Facade
Tropical Fig in the Indoor Garden
Cozy Kitchen and Dining Amid a Snow Blizzard
Coffee? Oh yes! Grinder, Coffee Maker, Maca Pot, French Press!
Twin Child Bed in a Cozy Loft Above the Kitchen
Reading and Music Room with an Herb Garden
Left Door: Bath, Right Door: Master Bedroom
Reading and Music Room. TV and Satellite WiFi are also working for Netflix specialists
High Fidelity Collector’s Sound System with all the Boom! Your Heart Desires
