Yep. Do Business While Being Inspired by the Mountains. This is a Sustainable Odor-Free Composting Toilet.
Hot Tub with a Sprawling View of the Milky Way.
Guest Barn Built Out of Timber Framing

primaryHost.about: Living at 2.5km (8450ft) above sea level in Colorado's gorgeous Rocky Mountains. Only 20 minutes from Boulder & 60 minutes from downtown Denver. Gold Hill is the centre of my universe!

reviews.comments:
Thank you Dorothy for letting us unwind while staying safe. We were looking for a local getaway for New Year’s, and Dorothy’s place was perfect. The space felt cozy with lots of natural light, and looking at the thoughtful architecture was inspirational. We had a lot of fun exploring the neighborhood and relaxing at the place listening to the rain.

Thank you for being super responsive and friendly - we had an amazing time. We will be back!
Second time staying here and can’t wait to stay again. Quiet location and has everything you need for a weekend stay.
Great Airbnb! Perfect location, parking was easy, the house is beautiful and comfortable. Highly recommend!
Unique design,  unparalleled luxury and amazing attention to details.
Really great staying at Dorothy’s beautiful house. Great music system and gym, with top grade amenities. Host super helpful. Thank you
Best Airbnb I’ve ever stayed at. Pictures don’t do it justice. Quiet location and super unique architecture/interior design. More than worth the cost.

Just finished a fantastic stay at the X-house. Just as the pictures showed and other reviews stated. Convenient location to Westwood, Beverly Hills, West Hollywood etc. well thought out space. Comfortable sofa and beds. Gym was very useful and a nice space for a daily workout. Cooked several meals in the eel designed and well stocked kitchen. Parking the first time was a bit tricky but by the second day it was a breeze. Excellent value for a great stay.
The place is fully loaded. The host has got a good taste and the unit is beautifully furnished. Best experience on Airbnb.

Beautiful modern home with refreshing concepts and perfectly minimalistic stylish interior design. All amenities anticipated, host is very communicative and accommodating. Parking on the side of the street, however, our car got hit while parked.

Amazing house, great location, and will absolutely be staying here again the next time we visit LA.  The space was very well utilized and had everything we needed to feel like a home away from home.  Dorothy was also very responsive and accommodating which made our stay seamless.

My first time trying Airbnb and man i tell you this house was the best house i ever been too I thought i was a celebrity in beverly hills lol it was so clean & nice i was just amazed when I first walked in the host was was very communicatcble too i would give 10 stars if i could!!

This was an excellent location for our needs. Clean, with great outdoor spaces, excellent, well-stocked kitchen, and extremely communicative hosts. We found the layout to be super chic, and the amenities to be spot on. One of the best we've stayed in.

I had an amazing trip, this house had  every convenience available. Awesome  features and very strong value for cost. This is now my favorite place to stay in Los Angeles. The design is truly stunning, clean, upscale and at the same time a simplified home with an emphasis on function. Absolutely no unnecessary items seen. My favorite thing about this property is that I loved being in the hills, yet it was close to everywhere I needed to go. My three night stay was so peaceful, my favorite thing was waking up in the mornings and hearing the birds chirping faintly whilst having tea on the second floor patio. Then dining at night on the rooftop was just as lovely. The house is so much better than in the pictures, a beautiful vibe.
House is stunning. Better than photos. Great location. Super easy to find. Super easy check in. Extremely clean. 10/10

Our stay at Dorothy’s place was very nice! It’s a beautiful place with an amazing rooftop and lighting and very well stocked with amenities for the bathroom and kitchen. It’s on a very busy/narrow street which can get tricky when running or walking but we figured it out! Dorothy is very quick to respond to questions. Getting in was easy and the location is very nice. Close to Beverly Hills shopping, Sunset and the beaches. Have fun there!
Gorgeous home very close to Rodeo drive and Beverly Hills. The owner is very responsive and helpful. Highly recommend!

I really enjoyed my stay at this place, beautiful house with two patios where I enjoyed a cup of coffee every morning. Whenever I had any questions, Dorothy was quickly available to provide answers which I appreciate. The location is very convenient as well.
This stay was definitely worth it. A beautiful piece of art this house was. Perfect weekend getaway for me and my wife.
Very cool property in convenient location!
The architecture of this house alone is worth the trip to visit. Nestled in the hills it is a perfect quiet getaway that’s close to the city. I highly suggest checking this cool pad out.

primaryHost.about: I am an Interior Designer in Los Angeles.  I love great design and spectacular views.  I enjoy hiking with my dog.  My husband is a general Contractor and we are building our own custom home in Bel Air.

name: JTHAVN-Joshua Tree Remote Dessert Bubble Dome

reviews.comments: We had a very pleasant stay here! The place looks exactly like the photos. We stayed during the winter so it was a bit chilly, but with sufficient layers + provided heaters/blankets, we had no issues. The hot tub was fun (and a lot of work). I suggest bringing more firewood than you think you’ll need to keep the hot tub going. The place is pretty secluded, but we did see/hear dirt bikes in the afternoon through the evening. We also enjoyed how it was only a short drive to the national park, restaurants, and grocery store. All in all, this place was beautiful and perfect for a short weekend getaway. Would highly recommend!
Great host! Karen is very friendly and responsive. The place should have some upgrades and maintenance for the curtains. They should also provide more propane during winter season.

Beautiful experience love it wish they provided firewood that would be my only request
It wasn’t as cold as you may think we were fine layering even without the heater but the heater and the blanket warmer made it so cozy. You’ll be fine with thermals underneath your clothes and a hoodie. Was amazing stay
This place was awesome! Super cool place to chill for a night.

This is an iconic Airbnb and one of the most unique ones you will ever live in.

The curtains could use better maintenance since they kept falling off.

The one big challenge we faced during our winter travel is that it gets really cold inside. This airbnb is off the grid and thus doesn't have conventional heating. The bed has heating pads and will keep you mildly warm while you sleep but when you are awake, you cannot freely roam inside the room. Even while sleeping, we needed the provided couple of propane powered portable heaters to run at full blast. They run out after 2 hours so you need to wake up and change the tank. The tanks needs to be purchased by the guest, we checked in late after 12 AM and fortunately were already aware of the situation so we got tanks upfront, it would have been a nightmare if we didn't know about it.

Overall, good Airbnb but heating is a serious problem, so plan your travel in times where temperatures are moderate.
BEST PLACE I EVER STAYED IN

It’s was beautiful and peaceful. Bed is very comfortable. For the price I thinks it’s becoming a bit dated.
Maybe expecting more for this price. Example dishes, firewood and so on. Would recommend.

Amazing stay, I love the location and everything. Great amenities.
Romantic, Secluded just beautiful and peaceful
Highly recommend this place if you're celebrating a special day! The hosting team thought through every single detail to make the stay comfortable and special.

What you see in the pictures is pretty darn close to what you experience when you arrive. It's pretty surreal at first, and you just accept that this is awesome and you gotta make the most of it asap. I really have no gripes about anything.

The hot tub was a funny experience, though. We knew - after watching the provided hot tub video - that we should fire it up as soon as we got there. So that's what we did. I brought a thermometer and checked the water temp about 1.5hrs in and it showed 95 degrees. Perfect! Buuut...we didn't realize that just the surface of the water was warm. I hopped in and the bottom half of the tub was freezing haha. We forgot to mix up the water, and it just took too long to heat up. So my only tip is to fire it up asap, MIX UP THE WATER every half hour or so, and wait about 3hrs for it to be ready for your weary bones.

Karen, the host, was great overall. Very responsive and proactive with communication. Professional across the board.
We had a great time!
One of the best Airbnbs to stay at. The view at Night with stars is unbelievably beautiful. Would definitely recommend to book it.

The main issue I had was that it wasn’t mentioned anywhere in the listing that it was a wood fired “hot tub”, and I thought it was a regular solar powered hot tub since it said that the place was solar powered. After booking, I was sent instructions and details for the place and it mentioned i needed fire wood for the tub and that it take 3-5 hours to get to 90° degrees. I tried to cancel the place after I found out it was not a traditional hot tub to find a place that has a hot tub thats doesn’t require labor because I was staying just for the night but they said that Its not their fault and I’d have to contact airbnb. I deal with chronic pain so I always want a place with a nice hot tub. It it was misleading to not mention the hot tub needs firewood in the listing, and inconsiderate that they didn’t refund me so i could have found something that works for me as far the hot tub goes. The place is obviously beautiful, but the hosts are not completely transparent in the listing.

The place is a good experience. I would go back. On the other hand I didn’t like the way was our check-in. By the time we were suppose to get in, the place was not ready for us. No sheets / blanket was on the bed. The housekeeper was still going back and forth to bring them to the location. Also the propane was not there. The same lady had to drive to pick up them somewhere and drop them off after 30/40 min. I understand that things can happen and maybe the other guests left the Airbnb later than recommended and they had all this trouble to set in for us but we didn’t hear any sorry or explanation anytime. I was surprising my husband and just wanna to get there with every time looking nice.

Advice: depend on the time of the year you go, expect to not have a warm hot tub, doesn’t matter how much wood you fill in it. We put 3 bundles and waited 4/5 hours and it was still not warm enough.

Please make sure you check with the Host that all of the amenities are working at the time you get there.

We had to wait an hour till our electricity, water & gas was up & running and that was very distressing because of the darkness, lack of service in the area & coolness of the desert night.

But Karen did send someone to get everything up & running & gave me 30% off our nightly rate to compensate.

Planned a little getaway for my husband and I. This was everything I wanted. We had such a good time. Loved looking at the night sky and soaking in the tub. Karen was very attentive and communication was a breeze.

had an amazing time here it was beautiful! thank you karen for providing an oasis like this..💖for future people just be sure to bring extra propane and maybe a heater too fill up the room because it got way colder at night than we expected..was such a cool experience!

I was looking to disconnect from LA/life and get away. I like the concept of the bubble dome. I likes how i got to see the stars, moon, and watch the sunrise. Unfortunately, I’m anemic and brought exts blankets but wasn’t truly prepared and wished there was at least a heated blanket. Also, space heater wasn’t able to use it as the propane bottle was empty. Also the sun made outside good enough to take a shower but I wasn’t able to because the water heater never warmed up the water. Overall still has a relaxing experience.
Beautiful place! Booked it as a surprise for my bf’s birthday and it was a total success. Loved the experience
It was a great experience! Definitely would love to come back!
Beautiful location, easy to drive to town or to the corner store for firewood for a fire or the hot tub! Clean and exactly how listed! Was definitely worth it!

name: EAGLE'S WATCH MALIBU- Architectural w/ Ocean View

reviews.comments: Most beautiful place you will ever stay at period
beautiful views
Beautiful Home.

Eagles Nest is a beautiful place with that nostalgic old Hollywood feel. The views are gorgeous and the house was well stocked. Katherine left a wonderful assortment of pleasantries at check in that we enjoyed during the whole stay. Was a wonderful place to get away.
breathtaking…….. such a special place… book it if you can..  its a gift….. katherine is great…..you will love it
reviews.response: Thank you Carlo!  We loved hosting you and your wife!  We would love to have you back anytime!

reviews.comments: It was hard to believe that a place so special in the photos could live up to our expectations in reality. There was so much room to either spread out or congregate.  We really appreciated all the cooking utensils, pots and pans---really everything you need. Views from every window were breathtaking. The house is truly one-of-a-kind! We highly recommend!

Beautifully located hillside, the house was designed to optimize views of the ocean. In the morning from the living room we enjoyed watching pods of dolphins swim by. It was spacious , clean and comfortable. Katherine didn't respond to messages until 24hrs before we arrived, which was disconcerting, but afterwards there was quick communication and she was very responsive. We would enjoy returning in the future.

This home is amazing and exactly how shown and described, although you can't really capture the beauty of the view and such through photos. Every window and every angle is/has an amazing view of the hills and the ocean. The home is very spacious and great for having guests over for dinner. Katherine (host) and her family are very friendly, super helpful, and great at ongoing communication. We will definitely stay here again in the future. It's a great place to bring your well-behaved furry friend as well.
Beautiful, iconic house. Amazing views!!! Would stay here a million more times!

The house was very cool & interesting architecture. Beautiful views, you could see and hear the ocean, very serene. It was decorated in almost a modern Brady bunch way that reflected the character of the home, we felt it was very cutely done.

Host greeted us with her darling boys who helped carry luggage.

After seeing the tram my group & I decided that was a better way to get up and down vs the steps.

Few cons but this is also a newly listed home & just standard kinks to be worked out.
The host was responsive to bathroom w no lights, a weird deal with the top floor shower.
I personally felt the home needed a true deep cleaning & cabinet clutter cleared but that’s also just my personal preference & how I live in my day to day life.

Beds were comfy, AC & fans for each room as well. The beach air also keeps things cool.

I will say honestly the stairs in & around the home are VERY steep. This would not be ideal for smaller children, elderly with any type of knee or hip issue.

We did have issues trying to get an Uber to pick us up, in five days not once could we get an Uber. So I’d advise you request the covered parking at the base of the tram vs trying hike up & down the upper steps.

Hired Chef Dave for one evening at the House, it’s a great place to bring in a private chef.

Host had a handful of good dining recommendations which we enjoyed. The arrival snacks were also a treat!

Amazing location and incredible views. It’s a special place. For parents with young kids just note that there are many stairs inside and they are very steep. Our son is 3 1/2 and is cautious so we knew he wouldn’t use the stairs without waiting for us to hold his hand. But if you have younger kids who toddle around this would likely not work. Depends on the kiddo. However, we had an amazing time and spent every night outside stargazing and enjoying the hot tub. The outdoor spaces are fantastic and the view is gorgeous. Katherine & Rory were accommodating and helpful with our luggage and deliveries, pack & play and baby gear, and had great snacks in the home for us on arrival. It was a special trip for our family.
Beautiful piece of Malibu history with amazing views. Great place to getaway and relax. Just amazing. Thank you Katherine and Rory for your hospitality and being such wonderful hosts.
What a beautiful home! And such a kind host!

The Eagle’s Watch home is a Malibu treasure and Katherine was a lovely host. Staying in this home is a gift and an experience all on its own. You wont find better views in Malibu. We really loved our stay and we were sad to leave. Book this if you want a once of a lifetime experience.

Our stay was as fantastical as the photos suggested. Plus with the stove it made for a very cozy and beautiful place to relax with friends. Ruth and Jeff were incredibly fast at responding and made sure we were taken care of from the beginning. We hope to be back!
Very relaxing and groovy place to stay at. Very clean and tidy with nice amenities.
A wonderful find for a getaway. Will be returning!
Unforgettable experience. Great hosts. Thank you so much!
This is a one of a kind experience. The hosts were so kind and accommodating. The house is one of my all time favorite stays and I can'twait to go back.  absolutely beautiful
Everything was great - thanks so much!

The Hobbitat is a gift of art to the world and THE place for a fantastical getaway. It's truly a piece of art and a one of a kind experience that is not to be missed. I wasn't planning on visiting Crestone but saw the Hobbitat and immediately booked it and it was the best impulse decision my ADHD brain has ever made. The nearby hot springs provide a peaceful escape and unique places like the Crestone Ziggurat are an added bonus to this magical escape not only was the home amazing but the hosts were so wonderful and helpful. I can't wait to come back and escape again!

AirBnB is super cool! The host’s home is directly next to the house which we didn’t realize from the listing but they respected our privacy. Also the house is heated only by fire so the house definitely gets chilly in the winter. Overall a super unique stay - would recommend!

Absolutely wonderful experience! This place was magical and everything we could have asked for and more! We will definitely be back and would like to thank the owners for being so kind! You can feel the love that they put into this place and I cannot thank them enough for sharing it. We loved EVERY minute and every aspect of our visit.

Gorgeous place that surpassed expected coolness. Fun interior perfect for meditating, photoshoots and watching the sunrise and set. I will note the listing does not indicate but the owners live onsite about 5 yards from the place and in the winter the heater needed to be shut up for a couple hours and cleaned by the owner each day, but great place to visit and explore the nearby dunes.

Incredibly unique experience getting to stay in a piece of art. Amazing views from the 2 balconies. Also cozy and d functional. Perfect location for a weekend of Sand Dunes and Hot Springs. Also close to downtown Crestone with access to cafe, grocery store, gas station. Will definitely come back and recommend this amazing home to others visiting the area!
This is an amazing space. It’s like staying in a work of art. So much effort and loving care has been put into this property. Really worth visiting

Amazing spot! This place was like no other, and to think the owner made it with his own hands. This is literally an art exhibit you can stay at. Crestone was super cute and quirky! Hope to come back again one day. If you’re traveling through CO, make sure you stay here! :)
What a wonderful place this was. Everything about this stay was fantastic. A very unique and beautiful place to stay at.
Great stay! Quiet, peaceful, just as described. Super cute!
Truly amazing stay. Very welcoming and kind hosts and a true work of art! Make sure to check out the Hotsprings while there.

We were absolutely blown away by the intricate details and amazing architecture of the Hobitat. It can only be experienced in-person, high end finishes and unlike any other home we’ve visited. Crestone is also very unique, we enjoyed the Valley View Hot Springs (be sure to make a reservation) and dinner at Food is Art. The Great Sand Dunes were unreal, like trudging through a painting. Couldn’t recommend a journey to this part of Colorado more!

I cannot empathize enough how incredible this space is. Every angle you look at it from, you discover a new treasure. This is by far the coolest place I’ve ever stayed, and Jeffrey was a wonderful host. I think I said at least 17x during our stay that I want to live there, I never want to leave lol
reviews.response: Thanks Jenna and Chris. Do come back!

reviews.comments: We had a wonderful time staying at the unique Hobbitat house for 3 nights.   Situated in a great dark sky location (for astronomy buffs) near Crestone,  Colorado, its a quiet & comfortable retreat.  It also has easy access to nearby National Wildlife Refuges (particularly birding) and the Great Sand Dunes National Park.  Highly recommended and we would like to stay there again on our next vacation tour of the Southwest region.

This was the most unique Airbnb I have ever stayed in! It was a true experience coming from the architecture and photography industries. Jeffrey and Ruth were polite, helpful and gracious; they were enjoyable to talk to and great hosts.

photos.caption: This Gaudiesque, curvilinear and spacious structure is set put you at ease. Living in the round takes away the edges!

name: Invisible House Joshua Tree | Modern Masterpiece

reviews.comments:
We stayed over a week to celebrate the Thanksgiving Holiday. It took us a couple of days to get used to the layout but the house grew on us very quickly.

The place warms up quickly and there were plenty of blankets and soft pillows to lounge around on. The stars at night are unbelievably beautiful and the master suite is a perfect spot to fall asleep under them. You will wake up to a beautiful sunrise to start your day of exploring and climbing.

The place is quite Beautiful during the day as well. And the wood fire pit outside was a really fun experience with our kids. We toasted marshmallow and howled at the moon 🌚

It would have been nice if the pool could be heated higher than 70 degrees but due to it being cold already and the size of the pool being massive the pool attendant said it was impossible.

The super loon light was a nice touch in one of the rooms and honestly we can’t wait to go back.
reviews.response: Thank you so much for your kind words! It means a lot to us. I hope we could do more about the pool during your stay. I hope you could come back and have better time in the pool when it's not too cold. Looking forward to your next visit!

reviews.comments: un lugar hermoso! las instalaciones son impresionantes!

localizedReview.comments: a beautiful place! The facilities are awesome!

reviews.comments:
非常棒的一次体验！房子的外观十分特别，惊艳到了我们所有人！
在周边你可以选择和朋友一起徒步，爬山，或者在房子里游泳，都是很棒的选择！
房子很干净，设施很齐全，房东也特别友好，给我们讲解了许多，十分感谢！
如果还有机会，一定还会继续选择！

localizedReview.comments:
It was a great experience! The exterior of the house was so special and we were all amazed!
You can choose to hike with friends, climb the mountain, or swim in the house, it's all great!
The house is very clean, the facilities are very complete, the host is also very friendly, he explained a lot to us, thank you very much!
Will definitely go back if I have a chance!

primaryHost.about:
Fieldtrip (@stayfieldtrip) is a boutique hospitality brand elevating the short term rental experience. We design, develop, curate, and professionally operate a portfolio of design-focused properties. 

The Fieldtrip experience combines the amenities and service of a luxury lifestyle hotel with the privacy and intimacy of a home. All Fieldtrip guests can expect high-end design and amenities, access to our dedicated hospitality concierge, 24/7 guest support, and professional cleaning standards.

Fieldtrip is headquartered in Los Angeles, with full-time local teams in each of our markets. Our current portfolio spans Joshua Tree, Newport Beach, Los Angeles, Palm Springs and Temecula.

name: Spectacular Earthship
address: Taos County, New Mexico, United States

reviews.comments: We had a wonderful stay and would love to visit again. The greenhouse is beautiful and provided ample heat to keep the living spaces warm despite the wintry weather. Overall it was the perfect getaway to just relax and enjoy the beautiful landscape.

Beautiful home with breathtaking views. The greenhouse provides a wonderful floral scent throughout the house. Extremely comfortable inside. The hosts are very responsive and caring. Definitely recommend staying here.

Rohin & Michelle’s earthship is a one of a kind stay! It is a unique home and experience with beautiful scenery. I was surprised at how well the living area stayed warm while outside temps were in the teens/20’s at night. Michelle was really helpful and responsive. I recommend this Airbnb to anyone looking for  an out of the ordinary experience.
Favorite place we’ve ever stayed! Incredibly unique, peaceful, and beautiful escape!
It was a dream come true to stay in an Earthship.   The home is beautiful and super comfortable.  It has everything that one needs for a pleasant stay.

Walking into Rohin & Michelle's earthship for the first time was amazing. The plantings in the greenhouse are just beautiful, the geraniums lent the entire greenhouse an incredible floral scent while not being overpowering. Just stunning!
We ate out both nights, but the kitchen was perfectly stocked for home cooking. The bed was super comfortable, and the earthship was immaculate upon arrival.
The earthship is located outside Taos by about 15-20 minutes, close enough to restaurants but far enough away to be very quiet and private.
We would highly recommend this property and would definitely come back again!
Amazing accommodations in a beautiful setting. Peaceful and private but also conveniently close to town. Would definitely stay here again. Highly recommend.
The earthship was amazing! The photos don’t do justice to how peaceful and beautiful it is. Very spacious with amazing views of the sunrise.
Beautiful green house!

We had such a peaceful stay at this earthship! It was super cute and clean, and we loved hanging out in the front room/greenhouse and soaking up the sun. We appreciated all the little details like the geranium flower in a vase and the artistic folding of the towels. Also there was a great selection of kitchen implements. We’re really grateful to Rohin and Michelle for such a lovely getaway!

We had the most incredible stay.  I have wanted to stay in an Earthship for a long time and Rohin & Michelle’s global plan build was just perfect.  A 10 minute walk from the Earthship Biotecture community office - and just gorgeous surroundings.  The place was clean and cozy - lovely views and just a fantastic place to get away.  Thank you!

If you've ever wanted to experience Earthships firsthand then this property is for you. Great location and a wonderful experience for me and my wife. The hosts were accommodating and the communications from Michelle was prompt and concise. I've already recommended this property to several friend and they have already booked.
If the earth ship experience in on your to do list, this property will not disappoint. And what can I say about the location. Taos, NM. It doesn't get much better. 5 stars
Amazing! Breathtaking views and a beautiful home!
Awesome spot!

Had such a dreamy and magical experience staying in this Earthship. Was the perfect place to reset and slow down. The daily views, doing yoga in the greenhouse and relaxing in this space was an incredible time. 15-20 minutes from Taos and all the great downtown things to do. Definitely put this on your list for places to stay!

This was a great opportunity to learn about and briefly experience an Earthship.  It was a very positive experience.  Communication was excellent with Michelle. The ship was clean, quiet, and comfortable.  The kitchen had everything we needed and then some.  The Earthship is beside highway US 64, and although it’s not a busy highway, there was a bit of road noise.  Overall, it was a terrific experience and a great place to relax.
Amazing stay! Beautiful views and perfect for a peaceful getaway to disconnect. 10/10
Our stay at this earth ship was nothing short of magical. Enjoy magnificent sunrises and sunsets, seeing storms come across the horizon, and a spectacular display of the night sky. We loved it!
Had a fantastic stay at your beautiful home! 10/10 would stay again. Fell in love with Taos and the earthship community. Thanks for a wonderful time :)

Amazing stay. We came for the Earthship, but found so many little surprises along the way. The best vacation we’ve had so far, no exaggeration. The locations was everything. Hiked Wheeler peak (40ish mins away), and ate and so many amazing restaurants. Taos is unforgettable.

We were a bit surprised that there were so many other earth houses, but they weren’t very close by so it didn’t matter. There was a lot of cool literature about Earthships at the stay.

If the US wasn’t so huge and if life wasn’t so short, we would come again.

Beautiful

primaryHost.about: We are a family who loves to have adventures that involve traveling & eating.  And we enjoy sharing our favorites spots with friends and family, especially those with good food (anything with noodles or coffee!) and good music. We look forward to hosting you or being a guest in your home!
